intro: Lessertia benguellensis, commonly known as the Benguella lesser celandine, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. It has compound leaves with three leaflets and is often found in coastal regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
